briefdescription.para: Bus fault: prefetch fault, memory access fault.
Usage fault: Undefined instruction or illegal state.
System service call via SWI insruction.
USB high priority or CAN TX.
USB low priority or CAN RX0.
USB wakeup from suspend through EXTI line.

detaileddescription.para: Each positive-valued enumerator is the position of the corresponding interrupt in the vector table. Negative-valued enumerators correspond to interrupts controlled by the system handler block.

parameterdescription.para: Offset from vector_table_address. Some restrictions apply to the use of nonzero offsets; see ST RM0008 and the ARM Cortex M3 Technical Reference Manual.

detaileddescription.para: Set interrupt priority for an interrupt line
Note: The STM32 only implements 4 bits of priority, ignoring the lower 4 bits. This means there are only 16 levels of priority. Bits[3:0] read as zero and ignore writes.

parameterdescription.para: Priority to set, 0 being highest priority and 15 being lowest.

briefdescription.para: Enables interrupts and configurable fault handlers (clear PRIMASK).
Disable interrupts and configurable fault handlers (set PRIMASK).

detaileddescription.para: Calling this function is significantly faster than calling nvic_irq_disable() in a loop.
